As Hahn reported, “Following a new primary election poll showing that House Speaker Paul Ryan has plummeted to well below 50 percent in his home district, Ryan is out with new mailers assuring Wisconsin voters of his desire to secure the border, and urging them to support him in his contentious August 9th primary election.”

We’ll also hear from former Navy SEAL Tej Gill of Projectwarpath.com, the creator the “Hillary Clinton Killed My Friends” t-shirts.

Michael Walsh, calling in from Ireland, will discuss his latest op-ed in the New York Post titled “3 things Trump could learn from Nixon’s 1968 campaign.”

Paul Sperry will discuss his article in the New York Post on the newly released 28 pages from the 9/11 Report revealing the Saudi government’s involvement in helping the hijackers.

Breitbart’s Executive Chairman Stephen K. Bannon, Editor-in-Chief Alex Marlow, and Washington Political Editor Matt Boyle will guest host a special edition of Breitbart News Sunday on the eve of the RNC Convention in Cleveland and in the wake of yet another deadly ambush of police officers.

Kyle Shideler of the Center for Security Policy will discuss his article for Breitbart titled “Unclassified 28 Pages of 9/11 Report Reveal Lost Ground in Fight against Jihad.”

Live from Cleveland, Breitbart’s Patrick Howley will report on the death of the Never Trump movement.
Breitbart Texas Editor Brandon Darby and Breitbart’s Lee Stranahan will report the latest on the deadly shooting of three police officers in Baton Rouge, Louisiana, today.
Breitbart News Sunday is broadcast live on SiriusXM Patriot Channel 125 from 7PM to 10PM Eastern.
Breitbart’s Julia Hahn will report on the panic in Speaker Paul Ryan’s re-election campaign.
Follow Breitbart News on Twitter for live updates during the show.
